name: skin cell
description: Mammals such as humans have 2 layers of skin cells - Epidermis (outer) and Dermis (inner).

name: fat cell
description: There are two types of fat cell, white and brown. Brown cells are used to generate heat and are found mostly in newborn babies and hibernating mammals. White fat cells store fat, and will grow in size to accomodate extra fat before finally reproducing to form additonal cells. It is the white cells that lead to obesity.

name: muscle cell
description: Contain protein filaments actin and myosin, which slide past each other, producing a contraction with changes the shape of the cell. Used for movement, muscle cells are also responsible for the heart beating and moving food through the digestive system via 'peristalsis'

name: In the cell - mitchondria
description: This cell organelle turns ADP into ATP using glucose from the food we eat and oxygen from the air we breathe. Our bodies then use ATP as fuel, meaning we are dependent on these tiny organelles.

name: In the cell - cell nucleus
description: Most cells are divided into 2 areas- the cytoplasm, where most activity takes place, and the nucleus. The nucleus houses the DNA of a cell, and in order to protect the DNA is strictly off limits to most things. Copies of the DNA, in the form of RNA, are taken from the cell nucleus and moved into the cytoplans for use in transcribing proteins.
